course_title: Special Topics: QTM: Adventures in Modeling
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 13Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: (Topic: Adventures in Modeling): This course provides an introduction to models with an emphasis on how they're used in several fields. Models, when done right, provide an invaluable lens with which to view the world and think about policy solutions as well as empirical assessment. There will be an emphasis on what makes for a "good" model and what factors go into constructing a good model, such as substantive motivation, key variables/correlations, as well as how one approaches policy implications and statistical estimation. Potential topics include COVID/fake news, Rebellions/protests, matching/fair division, consumer choice/voting, and career concerns/contests.
course_description: Special Topics Courses. Includes Game Theory I/II, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Longitudinal Data Analysis, Experimental Methods, Survey Research Methods, Computational Modeling, and Advanced Topics: Bayesian Statistics.
prerequisites: QTM 110 and QTM 120 and QTM 210 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 6319, Section #: 6, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 2:30-5:30p, Instructor: S. Tyson, Status: Open
